headline: Air Fryer Falafel
description: Once you've soaked your chickpeas, you can use a food processor and an air fryer to quickly bake these spicy falafel patties.
name: Air Fryer Falafel
recipeIngredient: 0.75 cup fresh flat-leafed parsley, stems removed
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Soak chickpeas in a large amount of cool water for 24 hours. Rub the soaked chickpeas with your fingers to help loosen and remove skins. Rinse and drain well. Spread chickpeas on a large clean dish towel to dry.

Blend chickpeas, cilantro, parsley, onion, and garlic in a food processor until a rough paste forms. Transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add chickpea flour, coriander, cumin, sriracha, salt, and pepper and mix well. Cover bowl and let mixture rest for 1 hour.
Preheat an air fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Add baking powder and baking soda to the chickpea mixture. Mix using your hands until just combined. Form 15 equal-sized balls and press slightly to form patties. Spray falafel patties with cooking spray.
Place 7 falafel patties in the preheated air fryer and cook for 10 minutes. Transfer cooked falafel to a plate and repeat with remaining 8 falafel, cooking for 10 to 12 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Great taste. I used chili flakes instead of sriracha to reduce amount of liquids. Maybe bread crumbs instead of flour would help. They stuck a bit through the grate in air fryer so I recommend parchment paper at bottom.

Great taste. I used chili flakes instead of sriracha to reduce amount of liquids. Maybe bread crumbs instead of flour would help. They stuck a bit through the grate in air fryer so I recommend parchment paper at bottom.

I made this as my first recipe in my new IP Duo Crisp. It turned out well. There are so many recipes on social media that are a heart attack waiting to happen. It was nice to find this healthy recipe to make.
